With number four Matt I think you are closest to the truth,
	A large tsuba is a hindrance for a mounted archer, encounters 
on horseback were rarely "tsuba to tsuba" therefore a handgaurd if it 
ever was one was unnecessary. A handstop on the other hand was of 
absolute necessity...
-t
